1.text: And Job will answer and say,

2.text: How long will ye, grieve my soul, and crush me with words?

3.text: These ten times ye will reproach me: ye will not be ashamed, ye will injure me.

4.text: If indeed I erred my error will lodge with me.

5.text: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and prove against me my reproach:

6.text: Know ye now that God subverted me; and he folded his net about me.

7.text: Behold, I shall cry violence, and shall I not be answered: I shall cry for help, and no judgment.

8.text: He walled up my path and I shall not pass, and he will set darkness upon my beaten paths.

9.text: And he put off from me my honor, and he removed the crown of my head.

10.text: He will lay me waste round about, and I shall go: and he will remove my hope as a tree.

11.text: And he will kindle his anger against me, and he will reckon me to him as his enemy.

12.text: His troops shall come together and raise up their way against me, and they will encamp round about to my tent.

13.text: He removed my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance truly turned aside from me.

14.text: My kindred ceased, and they acquainted with me forgot me.

15.text: They sojourning in my house and my maids, mill reckon me for a stranger: I was a foreigner in their eyes.

16.text: I called to my servant and he will not answer; I shall entreat him with my mouth.

17.text: My spirit was loathsome to my wife, and I entreated to the sons of my belly.

18.text: Also children rejected me; I shall arise, and they will speak against me.

19.text: All the men of my intimacy will abhor me, and those I loved were turned against me.

20.text: My bone cleaved to my skin and to my flesh, and I shall escape with the skin of my teeth.

21.text: Pity me, pity me, ye my friends, for the hand of God touched upon me.

22.text: Why will ye pursue me as God, and will ye not be satisfied from my flesh?

23.text: Who will give now, and my words shall be written? who will give and they shall be delineated in a book?

24.text: They shall be cut in the rock with a style of iron and lead, forever.

25.text: And I knew he redeeming me lived, and at last he shall rise up upon the dust:

26.text: And after they destroyed my skin, this, and from my flesh I shall see God:

27.text: Which I shall see for myself, and mine eyes beheld, and not a stranger: my reins were finished in my bosom.

28.text: For ye shall say, Why shall we pursue after him and the root of the word was found in me?

29.text: And fear ye to yourselves, from the face of the sword? for wrath the iniquities of the sword, so that ye shall know there is judgment.
